qas.question: Who invited Canadians to resettle in Mexico during the Mexican Revolution?
Today, Mexico accounts for what percentage of Mennonites in Latin America?
Mennonites speak a form of which language predominantly?
Which food do Mennonites excel in producing?
Mennonites account for about how much of the state's farm economy?

context: During the Mexican Revolution, <a0_0>Álvaro Obregón<a0_0/> invited a group of Canadian German-speaking Mennonites to resettle in Mexico. By the late 1920s, some 7,000 had immigrated to Chihuahua State and Durango State, almost all from Canada, only a few from the U.S. and Russia. Today, Mexico accounts for about <a1_0>42%<a1_0/> of all Mennonites in Latin America. Mennonites in the country stand out because of their light skin, hair, and eyes. They are a largely insular community that speaks a form of <a2_0>German<a2_0/> and wear traditional clothing. They own their own businesses in various communities in Chihuahua, and account for about <a4_0>half<a4_0/> of the state's farm economy, excelling in <a3_0>cheese<a3_0/> production.
